title: Active and Collaborative Learning Design for Microprocessor Education

context.prior_knowledge: Basic electronics and understanding of programming languages
context.additional_context: Advanced-level microprocessor utilization education for pre-service/in-service teachers. Requires collaborative learning modules and formative assessment-based feedback systems in a BYOD environment

learning_goals: Learners can analyze and explain the architecture and programming model of microprocessors.
In a collaborative learning environment, learners can solve real-world application problems related to microprocessors.
Using an LMS platform, learners can exchange peer feedback and achieve at least 80% of learning outcomes.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
